2804: :label: rem-observation-common-kernel-structure
2805: 
2806: Both mechanisms express expected measurements as **quotients of exponentially weighted sums**:
2807: 
2808: **Softmax**:
2809: 
2810: $$
2811: d_j = \frac{\sum_{\ell \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{j\}} d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell) \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell)/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}{\sum_{\ell \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{j\}} \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell)/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}
2812: 
2813: $$
2814: 
2815: **Diversity Pairing** (idealized):
2816: 
2817: $$
2818: \bar{d}_j = \frac{\sum_{M \in \mathcal{M}_k} d_{\text{alg}}(j, M(j)) W(M)}{\sum_{M' \in \mathcal{M}_k} W(M')}
2819: 
2820: $$
2821: 
2822: where $W(M) = \prod_{(i,\ell) \in M} \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,\ell)/(2\varepsilon_{\text{pair}}^2))$.
2823: 
2824: **Key Similarity**: Both are:
2825: - Smooth quotients (denominator bounded below by companion availability)

items.label: rem-rho-tradeoffs
items.title: Localization Scale Trade-offs
items.content:
5204: :label: rem-rho-tradeoffs
5205: 
5206: **Small ρ** (hyper-local, $\rho \ll \text{diam}(\mathcal{X})$):
5207: - ✓ **Pros**: Sharp localization, better low-order derivative bounds (m < 2d), geometric adaptation
5208: - ✗ **Cons**: High-order derivatives explode (m > 2d), numerical stiffness, small time steps for high-order integrators
5209: 
5210: **Large ρ** (global backbone, $\rho \sim \text{diam}(\mathcal{X})$):
5211: - ✓ **Pros**: Uniform derivative bounds, stable high-order behavior, larger time steps
5212: - ✗ **Cons**: Loses geometric information, weak adaptation, reverts to global statistics
5213: 
5214: **Optimal choice** (depends on application):
5215: - **Exploration phase** (early optimization): Large ρ for stability
5216: - **Exploitation phase** (near optima): Small ρ for geometric adaptation
5217: - **Adaptive schedule**: $\rho(t) = \rho_0 \cdot e^{-\gamma t}$ (annealing from global to local)

5207: - ✓ **Pros**: Sharp localization, better low-order derivative bounds (m < 2d), geometric adaptation
5208: - ✗ **Cons**: High-order derivatives explode (m > 2d), numerical stiffness, small time steps for high-order integrators
5209: 
5210: **Large ρ** (global backbone, $\rho \sim \text{diam}(\mathcal{X})$):
5211: - ✓ **Pros**: Uniform derivative bounds, stable high-order behavior, larger time steps
5212: - ✗ **Cons**: Loses geometric information, weak adaptation, reverts to global statistics
5213: 
5214: **Optimal choice** (depends on application):
5215: - **Exploration phase** (early optimization): Large ρ for stability
5216: - **Exploitation phase** (near optima): Small ρ for geometric adaptation
5217: - **Adaptive schedule**: $\rho(t) = \rho_0 \cdot e^{-\gamma t}$ (annealing from global to local)
